intro: Solea lanata, commonly known as the woolly sole, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, woolly stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Solea lanata is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, making it a resilient and hardy species.
